Taxon name.Name: Rhodococcus rhodochrous
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Rhodococcus rhodochrous (Zopf 1891) Tsukamura 1974 (Approved Lists 1980) emend. Rainey et al. 1995 emend. Nouioui et al. 2018 MB# 
Taxonomic synonyms: Rhodococcus roseus (ex Grotenfelt 1889) Tsukamura et al. 1991 MB#

Collector: J.C. Murrell, Univ. of Warwick, Coventry, UK
Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: documents providing proof of legal access and terms of use available at the collection
Metabolites production: Produces epoxides from ethene, propene and but-1-ene, although not from but-2-ene, pent-1-ene, or phenyl-propene.
Applications: Uses propane as a sole carbon source; oxidizes a range of short-chain primary and secondary alcohols (C2-C8) and representative cyclic and aromatic alcohols; produces epoxides from ethene, propene and but-1-ene, although not from but-2-ene, pent-1-ene, or phenyl-propene; transforms thioanisole; adheres to liquid hydrocarbons (n-hexadecane); resistant to n-hexane, ethanol; resistant to Mo6+ (5.0 mM).
